intro: Holboellia brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed holboellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough, hairy texture, while its stems are slender and often branched. Holboellia brevipes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
